This finding highlighted the role of CD226 in the co-stimulatory pathways that affect T cell activation and development, which are critical mechanisms in the pathogenesis of these autoimmune diseases.
title: Deletion of CD226 in Foxp3+ T cells Reduces Diabetes Incidence in Non-Obese Diabetic Mice by Improving Regulatory T Cell Stability and Function

finding: The SNP rs8090080 was linked to significant findings in the context of Wnt signaling, particularly related to cell motility and invasion. It played a role in understanding the parallels between developmental processes and cancer progression, as outlined in the work by Sedgwick and D'Souza-Schorey (2016). The study emphasized how Wnt signaling influences cancer cell behavior, thereby establishing the relevance of this SNP in cancer genomics.
title: Wnt- and Glutamate-receptors orchestrate stem cell dynamics and asymmetric cell division

finding: The SNP rs8084625 mapped to the GNAL gene, which is highly expressed in the central nervous system (CNS) and associated with cognitive deficits in bipolar disorder and schizophrenia. It had a significant p-value of 7.37016×10^-06 in the GWAS.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The SNP rs1786573 also mapped to the GNAL gene and had a borderline significant p-value of 7.37016×10^-06 in the initial GWAS analysis, indicating its potential relevance to cognitive processes.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The SNP rs2272783 A>G in FECH, associated with erythropoietic protoporphyria, demonstrated an allele frequency that was nearly three times higher in the Vietnamese and East Asian populations than in the world population, specifically 28.10%, 32.57%, and 11.23%, respectively.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs763361 in CD226 was identified as contributing to genetic susceptibility for type 1 diabetes. It caused a Gly307Ser missense mutation, which was linked to increased phosphorylation of downstream signaling molecules in human CD4+ T cells, as described in the context of its location near critical phosphorylation sites. This SNP was part of the Idd21.1 risk locus in the NOD mouse model, affirming its role in disease progression.
title: Inhibition of CD226 Co-Stimulation Suppresses Diabetes Development in the NOD Mouse by Augmenting Tregs and Diminishing Effector T Cell Function

finding: The SNP rs76726049 was indicated as a sentinel variant near the ALPK2 gene with a significant predicted effect on regulatory activity in CD14+ monocytes, while showing weak effects in microglia. This suggests that it may influence AD predisposition through monocyte-specific mechanisms rather than in brain resident microglia.
title: Regression convolutional neural network models implicate peripheral immune regulatory variants in the predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study indicated a strong association of the SNP rs613872 with Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD). Despite the strong association, no significant changes were observed in the corneal endothelial TCF4 mRNA level. This suggests that while the genetic variant was linked to the disease, its role in altering gene expression related to FECD pathogenesis, particularly regarding ferroptosis and oxidative stress response, was not directly tied to changes in mRNA levels.
title: TCF4 trinucleotide repeat expansions and UV irradiation increase susceptibility to ferroptosis in Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy

finding: The SNP rs3764512 emerged as the top candidate associated with the RAB27B gene in the context of major depressive disorder (MDD). It was located within an open chromatin region at the transcription start site of RAB27B and was identified through colocalization analysis, demonstrating its contribution to disease risk through increased chromatin accessibility and gene expression.
title: Genetic regulation of cell-type specific chromatin accessibility shapes the etiology of brain diseases

finding: The SNP rs11081074 was previously associated with the transcriptional roles of ALK fusion proteins in tumorigenesis. Specifically, the study illustrated that this SNP plays a role in the epigenetic alterations observed when oncogenes like NPM-ALK are induced, leading to deregulation of epigenetic enzymes and resulting in epigenomic changes similar to those found in human tumors. This supports the conclusion that genetic variations such as rs11081074 can influence the carcinogenic pathways governed by DNA methylation and the maintenance of tumor-specific epigenomic landscapes.
title: Requirement of DNMT1 to orchestrate epigenomic reprogramming during NPM-ALK driven T cell lymphomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs6507874, associated with the SMAD7 locus at 18q21.1, was linked to both colon and rectal cancers. The confirmation of this association reinforced the established role of SMAD7 in colorectal cancer susceptibility.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The common SNP rs17782313 in the MC4R gene was associated with greater long-term weight gain, increased risk of diabetes, and emotional eating in women. This finding related to how estrogen signaling affects activity behaviors and metabolic health, reinforcing the significance of MC4R in female energy homeostasis.
title: Estrogen Drives Melanocortin Neurons To Reduce Sedentary Behavior

finding: The rs9966620 SNP, implicated in diabetic retinopathy, was associated with the expression of TTC39C-AS1, a nearby gene. This SNP was most accessible in rod photoreceptors and was linked to a 3D chromatin loop, suggesting its role in modulating diabetic retinopathy risk through interaction with this gene.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The bQTL and caQTL rs993767 located in the CCBE1 locus showed significant impact on chromatin features, aligning with regression data indicating its relevance in regulatory mechanisms.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The bQTL and caQTL rs3114275 in the CCBE1 locus were validated to regulate chromatin accessibility, further confirming their relevance as regulatory elements in the context of CAD risk.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: RIT2 rs12456492 was linked to Parkinson's disease susceptibility through a meta-analysis of Asian populations, suggesting a genetic association. Additional studies indicated a similar association in Mainland China, reinforcing the idea that this polymorphism could play a role in the risk of developing Parkinson's disease across different demographics.
title: Rit2 silencing in dopamine neurons drives a progressive Parkinsonian phenotype

finding: The SNP rs11081178 was examined in the context of cancer research as discussed by Shamloo and Usluer in 2019. The association of this SNP with the regulation of p21 was highlighted, aligning it with the mechanisms that influence cell cycle arrest and proliferation in medulloblastoma cells, particularly in relation to the treatment effects observed with rosmarinic acid.
title: Modulation of Viability, Proliferation, and Stemness by Rosmarinic Acid in Medulloblastoma Cells: Involvement of HDACs and EGFR

finding: The SNP rs12955474 reached Bonferroni-corrected significance during replication analysis with a p-value of 8.1 x 10^-5. It had been previously reported in literature for its association with the third principal component (PC) of hearing thresholds across various frequencies.
title: Genome-wide association study and polygenic risk score analysis for hearing measures in children

finding: In linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs12955474, rs10503028 was also found to have significance with a p-value of 1.0 x 10^-4, related to hearing thresholds.
title: Genome-wide association study and polygenic risk score analysis for hearing measures in children

finding: This SNP was identified in LD with rs12955474 and reported a similar significance of p = 1.0 x 10^-4 in relation to hearing thresholds.
title: Genome-wide association study and polygenic risk score analysis for hearing measures in children

finding: In further analysis, rs35781152, which was in LD with rs12955474, demonstrated a significant association with a p-value of 1.2 x 10^-4 for hearing thresholds.
title: Genome-wide association study and polygenic risk score analysis for hearing measures in children

finding: The variant rs17758695 was associated with monocyte, platelet, red blood cell, and white blood cell counts, having a PIP greater than 99%. It was involved with BCL2 in several progenitor cell types, showing strong regulatory predictions.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs12454712 was fine-mapped for insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) and type 2 diabetes, adjusted by BMI. It lies in an intronic enhancer of the BCL2 gene, which encodes an anti-apoptotic transcription factor. This SNP was found within a regulatory region of pituitary stem cells and somatotropes, suggesting a potential role in pituitary stem cell differentiation. Both high and low levels of IGF-1 have been associated with insulin resistance and an increased risk of type 2 diabetes.
title: Single-cell multiome regression models identify functional and disease-associated enhancers and enable chromatin potential analysis

finding: The study identified rs173032 as a risk gene variant of meprin beta, which is implicated in Alzheimer's disease. This finding was derived from whole-exome sequencing of the BDR cohort, suggesting a genetic contribution to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility through the activation of the alternative beta-secretase enzyme, meprin beta, leading to increased amyloid beta levels.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease associated bacterial protease RgpB from P. gingivalis activates the alternative β-secretase meprin β thereby increasing Aβ generation

finding: The SNP rs7244213 was associated with 17 distinct features that differentiated anatomical, physiological, and physical characteristics among the three Prakriti types, thereby suggesting its relevance in understanding the features described in Ayurveda.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The study linked the SNP rs11081207 with increased tumor mass dormancy in certain cancer types, showing that this variant had a role in modulating the immune and angiogenic microenvironment of dormant tumors. It was associated with a favorable patient survival outcome, correlating with the observed dormancy-like signals in a significant subset of cancers. The findings highlighted the impact of genetic variants on tumor behavior in the context of immune surveillance and dormancy.
title: Pan-cancer survey of tumour mass dormancy and underlying mutational processes

finding: The rs11083046 variant C allele was found to have a 30% increased enhancer activity compared to the reference T allele, demonstrating its role in enhancing gene expression associated with prostate cancer.
title: Optimized high-throughput screening of non-coding variants identified from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs201123820 demonstrated genome-wide significant differences between opioid dependence (OD) cases and unexposed controls. It was significantly associated with postprocedural musculoskeletal disorders in the UK Biobank, highlighting its relevance to pain management and potential opioid usage.
title: Leveraging genome-wide data to investigate differences between opioid use vs. opioid dependence in 41,176 individuals from the Psychiatric Genomics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs151344523 was noted as a likely pathogenic variant within the context of an identified deletion in <italic>AFG3L2</italic> gene. This deletion was linked to the phenotype of cone-rod dystrophy in patient NEI_328, indicating a potential role in autosomal dominant optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The SNP rs151344522 was reported in ClinVar as a pathogenic variant located in the region affected by a 9722-bp deletion in <italic>AFG3L2</italic>. This association with cone-rod dystrophy in the patient strengthens the evidence for its involvement in autosomal dominant optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The SNP rs151344520 was included among the reported pathogenic or likely pathogenic variants in the lineage of the <italic>AFG3L2</italic> deletion affecting patient NEI_328, suggesting its potential contribution to the observed phenotype of AD optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The SNP rs797045221 was identified as a missense variant mapped in the deleted region of <italic>AFG3L2</italic> gene. Its presence alongside the deletion in patient NEI_328 points to its relevance in the development of cone-rod dystrophy, consistent with the known pathogenic effects linked to AD optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The SNP rs151344514 was observed to be likely pathogenic and was located within the region of the <italic>AFG3L2</italic> gene deletion affecting patient NEI_328. This finding implies a direct relation to the patient's cone-rod dystrophy and supports its role in AD optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The analysis suggested that shorter telomere length had a protective causal effect on mLOY, particularly highlighting significant effects when rs16978028 was removed in sensitivity analyses. This indicated a relationship between telomere length and mLOY, though the primary test using the IVW-RE method was not significant.
title: Association between mosaic loss of chromosome Y and pulmonary fibrosis susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs11081098 was associated with gene expression variability in cancer cell lines, indicating potential relevance for toxicity testing programs. It revealed that gene expression profiles of certain cancer cell lines overlap with normal human tissues, highlighting the complexity and challenges faced when utilizing these models in research.
title: Assessing the basal gene expression of cancer cell lines for in vitro transcriptomic toxicology screening

finding: The peak eSNP rs1788098 was identified as a significant NK cell-specific eQTL for CD226, colocalising with genetic loci linked to a range of autoimmune diseases including inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and type 1 diabetes (T1DM). Notably, reduced expression of CD226 correlated with increased disease risk, suggesting that diminished NK cell responses may heighten vulnerability to autoimmunity.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: rs1788097 was found to be an exact proxy for rs1788098 and demonstrated GWAS-significant associations with autoimmune diseases and hematological traits. This reinforces the connection of CD226 expression alterations to disease risk.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: For rs1032200, which is located in the STAT3 locus, the accessible chromatin region was detected exclusively in rectum fibroblasts. While this enhancer was not indicated as context-dependent in macrophages, it was robustly detected across various subpopulations, underscoring its relevance in the context of IBD.
title: Accessible chromatin maps of inflammatory bowel disease intestine nominate cell-type mediators of genetic disease risk

finding: The study reported that the nonsynonymous SNP rs2298645, characterized by a G>T substitution, resulted in the loss of a trypsin cleavage site in the HSBP1L1 gene, which encodes a missing protein. This SNP was noted to have no clinical relevance and was observed to have an approximate frequency of ~81% in the overall population according to various databases, including 1000 Genomes, ExAC, and ALFA.
title: Human Chr18: “Stakhanovite” Genes, Missing and uPE1 Proteins in Liver Tissue and HepG2 Cells

finding: The SNP rs4798131 in the DLGAP1 gene was found to be associated with everyday drinking. This gene was previously noted for associations with schizophrenia and various brain disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: This SNP demonstrated genome-wide significant association results (P < 5 × 10^-8) in the context of multi-trait analysis involving subcortical volume measurements.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs79143095 showed differential regulation of the TNFRSF11A gene (ENSG00000105641) in monocytes, indicating that expression was affected consistently in the same direction across lithium users and nonusers, albeit with significantly different magnitudes. This finding suggested that this SNP could be relevant for understanding the genetic regulation of gene expression in relation to lithium treatment in psychiatric disorders.
title: Cell type deconvolution of bulk blood RNA-Seq to reveal biological insights of neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The rs10502437 SNP demonstrated a strong colocalisation with eQTLs for low-grade cartilage, indicating that the risk allele positively influenced gene expression in this tissue context.
title: Decoding the genomic basis of osteoarthritis

finding: The missense variant rs79783591 at the MC4R locus, linked to obesity, was noted to be absent in the gnomAD browser but had an overall frequency of 1.1% in the MCPS cohort. The inferred frequency in Native Mexican populations was 1.6%, while the frequencies in African and European populations were less than 0.05%.
title: Genotyping, sequencing and analysis of 140,000 adults from the Mexico City Prospective Study

finding: The SNP rs9960767 was associated with the schizophrenia risk allele C, which was reported to disrupt sensorimotor gating in both schizophrenia spectrum individuals and healthy volunteers. This finding is relevant to understanding the role of TCF4 in neurodevelopmental pathways that may intersect with conditions such as Pitt-Hopkins Syndrome.
title: Tcf4 Deficiency Causes Recurrent Seizures in Mice

finding: The SNP rs11081213 had a positive original finding related to the immune checkpoint molecule LAG3, which is significant in the context of human cancer. This highlighted the biological processes motivating targeting LAG3 for therapy in cancer treatment, indicating that genetic variations at this locus could influence cancer progression and treatment outcomes.
title: Analysis of immune subtypes across the epithelial-mesenchymal plasticity spectrum

finding: The SNP rs61751192 was identified in the context of the Alk gene, which underwent long-term condensation observed at both 1 and 14 days post-cocaine exposure. Additionally, an upstream region containing rs61751192 experienced melting one day post-exposure, returning to a pre-melted state by the 14-day mark. This behavior indicated that rs61751192 may influence the chromatin dynamics related to Alk, a gene implicated in cocaine addiction pathways.
title: A single dose of cocaine rewires the 3D genome structure of midbrain dopamine neurons

finding: rs8084351 was found to be genome-wide significant in the meta-analysis with a p-value of 2.39x10^-9. It is located on chromosome 18q21.2 and acted as a brain eQTL for the DCC gene, which is involved in neuronal growth. It showed associations with ADHD, MDD, and various other mental health traits including cognitive traits and neuroticism.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs7235957 showed a strong statistical relationship with multiple CpG sites in the promoter region of the ENOSF1 gene, which is associated with shear stress in endothelial cells. This finding was based on a regional association plot, where a notable statistical significance (lowest p-value of 1.47×10^-38) indicated that this SNP could serve as a genetic instrument for analyzing DNA methylation related to shear stress in advanced atherosclerotic plaques.
title: Exploring the Causal Effects of Shear Stress Associated DNA Methylation on Cardiovascular Risk

finding: The rs335929 SNP was noted for its association with cognitive decline in Alzheimer’s patients, indicating a potential impact on cognitive performance and linking it to both NREM slow wave energy and prolonged wakefulness.
title: Haplotype of the astrocytic water channel AQP4 modulates slow wave energy in human NREM sleep

finding: The rs162008 SNP was highlighted for its role in reducing AQP4 expression and was part of the haplotype associated with EEG slow wave energy and cognitive tasks, suggesting it may play a part in sleep regulation through its influence on AQP4.
title: Haplotype of the astrocytic water channel AQP4 modulates slow wave energy in human NREM sleep

finding: The rs16942851 SNP was highlighted in the analysis and was specifically mentioned among the SNPs of interest for their combined effect on AQP4 expression and NREM sleep characteristics.
title: Haplotype of the astrocytic water channel AQP4 modulates slow wave energy in human NREM sleep

finding: The SNP rs7239151 showed context-dependent eQTL effects influencing CYB5A expression, with variability in expression based on cell state. Higher expression levels of CYB5A were associated with the GG genotype in B cells, suggesting significant implications for B cell activation and its role in disease.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs57631119 was identified as an eQTL for SMAD2 in CD4+ T cm cells and was linked to asthma in GWAS, with strong evidence of population-specific allelic distribution. This connection emphasized its relevance to TGF-beta signaling in asthma pathology.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: SNP rs113776891 was found to be associated with RMM in the PTPRM gene at the 18p11.23 region, with a p-value of 3.77×10-8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: SNP rs112288193 was also associated with RMM in the PTPRM locus, indicated by a CADD score of 14.64.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The SNP rs62091461 was identified as an independently-associated variant in close proximity to the Transcription Factor 4 (TCF4) and RAB27B genes, with the latter showing a p-value of 1.39 × 10^-9 for its association with depression.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: The SNP rs12966052 was one of the three independently-associated variants located in a 1.2 Mb region along 18q.21.2, which contained associations with depression related to nearby genes TCF4 and RAB27B.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: The SNP rs12967143 was part of the cluster of three independently-associated variants near the Transcription Factor 4 (TCF4) gene, which had a significant association with depression (p = 4.55 × 10^-16).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: Associated with neuroticism, rs10503002 replicated previous findings from GWASs related to mood disorders and psychopathology.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This variant was identified as a chromatin accessibility QTL in midfetal neural progenitors, aligning its functionality with the regulatory activities observed in the MDD context.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: The SNP rs613872, associated with ZEB1 and TCF4, was found to change the risk for late onset Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD) in a study involving patients from northern India. This association underscored the relevance of these genetic markers in defining the susceptibility to the disease.
title: Characterization of a novel mouse model for Fuchs Endothelial Corneal Dystrophy

finding: SNP rs145619574 on chromosome 18 was identified in the vicinity of WDR7 among ASDII patients.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs72917381 on chromosome 18 was noted among ASDII patients near WDR7.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The rs2000813 SNP in the LIPG gene, resulting in the T111I point mutation in the EL protein, was initially identified in individuals with elevated HDL-C levels. Studies had suggested associations between the Thr111Ile variant and increased HDL levels and reduced coronary heart disease risk. However, despite these associations, conflicting results were observed in subsequent research, which did not consistently link this SNP to altered HDL concentrations or a definitive impact on cardiovascular disease. Biochemical assessments indicated that the T111I variant did not affect the stability or enzymatic activity of endothelial lipase, thereby suggesting that its influence on HDL-C levels or cardiovascular disease risk was not mediated through these pathways.
title: Endothelial Lipase Variant, T111I, Does Not Alter Inhibition by Angiopoietin-like Proteins

finding: The SNP rs1893217 in the PTPN2 gene was found to promote increased expression of the SARS-CoV-2 receptor ACE2, facilitating viral entry mediated by the virus's spike protein. This SNP causes a loss of function in PTPN2 and is associated with increased risk for autoimmune diseases such as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Type 1 diabetes (T1D), and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). Elevated ACE2 expression levels and enhanced viral entry were linked to increased JAK-STAT signaling, which could be reversed by the JAK inhibitor tofacitinib. Furthermore, the study identified SNP rs1893217 as a potential genetic susceptibility biomarker for COVID-19, suggesting that carriers may have an increased risk for severe disease due to enhanced viral entry.
title: Identification of a Novel Susceptibility Marker for SARS-CoV-2 Infection in Human Subjects and Risk Mitigation with a Clinically Approved JAK Inhibitor in Human/Mouse Cells

finding: This SNP was found to be a new GWAS hit for psychopathology, thus contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on serious mental illnesses.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs11081208 was associated with the effects of polyphenols extracted from Andean potatoes, specifically related to their cytotoxic effect on human neuroblastoma cells. This association showcased the potential for polyphenols to induce programmed cell death mechanisms that are caspase-independent. The study highlighted the role of mitochondrial function and redox homeostasis alterations induced by these polyphenols, indicating significant implications for treatment strategies in tumor cells that typically exhibit resistance to apoptosis.
title: Red-purple Andean potato polyphenols have an anti-neuroblastoma effect in vitro via apoptosis through mitochondria

finding: The SNP rs17828933 was found to be associated with higher expression of a CD6 isoform lacking the d3 domain (CD6\u0394d3). This isoform is unable to bind its primary ligand, CD166, and correlates with increased susceptibility to multiple sclerosis (MS). The study highlighted the significance of the alternative splicing event induced by the impaired recruitment of the SRSF1 splicing factor, which promotes exon 5 inclusion, thereby influencing immune responses.
title: The dual character of the inhibitory functions of CD6

finding: The SNP rs8090726 was associated with the research study by Kosmala et al. (2016), which demonstrated the use of citizen science to validate plant phenology from near-surface remote sensing. The findings highlighted the role of citizen science in enhancing the accuracy and scale of phenological observations, linking genetic variations to broader ecological processes such as flowering and seasonal changes.
title: Opportunistically collected photographs can be used to estimate large-scale phenological trends

finding: The SNP rs17089887 was found to be positively associated with Fuchs' endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD) in a study conducted on an Indian population. This association underlined the importance of TCF4 intronic polymorphisms, particularly in relation to the pathogenesis of FECD, which leads to progressive vision impairment through loss of corneal endothelial cells.
title: Start codon disruption with CRISPR/Cas9 prevents murine Fuchs’ endothelial corneal dystrophy

finding: This SNP was reported as consistently associated with Alzheimer’s disease across multiple GWAS studies. It was linked to the down-regulation of the TAS2R41 gene and correlated with the upregulation of the EPHB6 protein, implicating its significant role in pathways related to neurodegeneration.
title: Genomic Study of Taste Perception Genes in African Americans Reveals SNPs Linked to Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1559586 was identified as another significant locus in the non-stratified GWAS for systemizing, with a p-value of 4.78×10−8. This SNP lies in a region of high genetic recombination and is associated with genetic factors influencing autism-associated behaviors, particularly restricted and repetitive behaviors.
title: Social and non-social autism symptom and trait domains are genetically dissociable

finding: The SNP rs8084351 located in the 18q21.2 region surrounding the netrin 1 receptor gene DCC was found to have the most pleiotropic association across eight psychiatric disorders, exhibiting a significant meta-analysis p-value of 4.26 x 10^-12. This region was associated with both major depression (MD) and neuroticism, highlighting its crucial role in neurodevelopment.
title: Genome wide meta-analysis identifies genomic relationships, novel loci, and pleiotropic mechanisms across eight psychiatric disorders

finding: The allele C at rs11663049 disrupted the E2F5 transcription factor binding site, which modified its regulatory effect on CEP192 expression, showcasing the variant's functional relevance in gene regulation within osteoarthritis context.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs11873030, located in the MALT1 gene, had a significant sQTL effect for a junction read specifically associated with multiple sclerosis. The risk allele (C allele) for this disease was linked to a decrease in expression of the MALT1-1 isoform, which is important for NF-kappaB signaling.
title: Immune Isoform Atlas: Landscape of alternative splicing in human immune cells

finding: The SNP rs11081121 was identified as a positive and original finding in a study that explored catecholamine storage and secretion in adrenal chromaffin cells. The alleviation of epinephrine storage defects came from mechanisms involving the Nod1 ligand, which linked the intestinal microbiota to adrenal medullary responses during stress. This study shed light on the role of the gut-brain axis, with implications for better understanding catecholamine-related physiological responses.
title: Intestinal microbiota modulates adrenomedullary response through Nod1 sensing in chromaffin cells

finding: The SNP rs11081162 was associated with the ligand-receptor interaction CTGF:LRP6, which was predictively linked to lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) progression. This finding was experimentally confirmed and showed that the LRP6 co-receptor might play a role in the pathogenesis and potential therapy of epithelial cancers.
title: Reconstructing co-dependent cellular crosstalk in lung adenocarcinoma using REMI

finding: The SNP rs11877146 was significantly associated with body fat percentage in humans. Notably, it was also identified as an eQTL for NPC1, similar to its pig homolog, emphasizing the conservation of regulatory mechanisms between species.
title: Integrating large-scale meta-GWAS and PigGTEx resources to decipher the genetic basis of complex traits in pig

finding: El-Ella et al. in 2018 stated that the CD226 gene polymorphism rs763361 was associated with susceptibility to type 1 diabetes mellitus among Egyptian children.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The SNP rs2289519, resulting in the P176S polymorphism in maspin, was linked to promoting gastric cancer. This finding highlighted a direct association between the maspin variant and tumorigenesis in gastric tissues.
title: P176S polymorphism in Maspin rewires electrostatic interaction that alters Maspin functionality

finding: The SNP rs2289520 was associated with oral cancer, as indicated in the findings. This association was noted to significantly affect cancer susceptibility, particularly within the context of maspin's role in cancer progression.
title: P176S polymorphism in Maspin rewires electrostatic interaction that alters Maspin functionality

finding: The SNP rs11081050 was associated with the downregulation of signaling pathways linked to tumor growth, metastasis, and hypoxia in human triple negative breast cancer, as reported in the study. This finding indicated that PD-L1 blockade through therapies like Atezolizumab could influence these critical pathways, potentially impacting treatment responses in patients with relevant mutations.
title: Therapeutic anti-PD-L1 antibody affects ESCRT-mediated functions in cells expressing oncogenic EGFR

finding: The SNP rs17749561 was associated with NHL risk, showing its connection to lymphocytic leukemia through high LD with rs4987855, further affirming the overlapping genetic risks between these cancer types.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs7241781 was linked to the lncRNA SNHG8 specifically in a subset of B cells. This association suggested a regulatory role in gene expression variation within that cell type.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs11081145 was associated with differences in B cell infiltration in KRAS-driven lung adenocarcinoma. This finding was significant as it highlighted the potential impact of this SNP on immunotherapy responses in colorectal cancer (CRC) by influencing tumor immune profiles.
title: Dissecting heterogeneity of tumor microenvironment in colorectal cancer using high-resolution single-cell atlas

finding: The SNP rs4800490, near the NPC1 gene, was noted for its association with 48 candidate traits, including a relationship with usual walking pace and alcohol intake frequency in context of BMI analysis.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs17782313 exhibited a strong association with total mass, reaching a P-value of 1.8 × 10^-26 via SynSurr, whereas its best P-value in standard GWAS was only 1.6 × 10^-5. This SNP had a well-characterized association with obesity prior to this analysis, highlighting its relevance in body composition traits.
title: Leveraging a machine learning derived surrogate phenotype to improve power for genome-wide association studies of partially missing phenotypes in population biobanks

finding: The SNP rs10775496 was identified as a lead variant affecting the regulatory activity of RELA in cerebellar hemisphere tissue, with a p-value of 7.6×10^-10. The nearest gene to this variant was SMAD4.
title: Identifying Genetic Regulatory Variants that Affect Transcription Factor Activity

finding: SNP rs12456284, located in the 3'-UTR of SMAD4, was identified as a plausible causal variant influencing RELA activity. It registered a p-value of 7.8×10^-10 in association with the previously noted aQTL.
title: Identifying Genetic Regulatory Variants that Affect Transcription Factor Activity

finding: The intronic SNP rs6566675 in NETO1, which plays critical roles in spatial learning and memory, was located in a differentially accessible region that was closed in the nucleus accumbens and dentate gyrus but opened in the Ammon’s horn following METH stimulus. This finding highlighted the chromatin accessibility dynamics in response to METH.
title: Methamphetamine induced regional-specific transcriptomic and epigenetic changes in the rat brain

finding: The SNP rs2217560 was positively associated with pulmonary arterial hypertension in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus. This finding suggested its potential role in cardiovascular complications related to autoimmune disorders.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs11081078 was associated with IL-27 receptor signaling in the context of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). The study found that genetic loss of IL-27 receptor signaling suppressed HCC development, suggesting that this SNP may influence the activity of immune cells, particularly Natural Killer (NK) cells, in the tumor microenvironment. The elevation of IL-27R expression indicated poor prognosis in HCC patients, making rs11081078 a significant finding regarding its potential role as an immunological checkpoint in HCC development.
title: IL-27R signaling serves as immunological checkpoint for NK cells to promote hepatocellular carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs12967143 was identified as an intragenic enhancer within the TCF4 gene. It demonstrated significant predictive causal association in specific neural cell types, indicating its relevance in the context of ketamine's rapid antidepressant action and the broader ketamine pharmacogenomic network.
title: Ketamine’s pharmacogenomic network in human brain contains sub-networks associated with glutamate neurotransmission and with neuroplasticity

finding: The risk allele C of the TCF4 rs9960767 polymorphism was shown to disrupt sensorimotor gating in individuals with schizophrenia spectrum disorders as well as in healthy volunteers. This finding demonstrated the association of TCF4, a bHLH transcription factor, with schizophrenia, highlighting its potential role in cognitive functions and disorders.
title: Daughterless, the Drosophila orthologue of TCF4, is required for associative learning and maintenance of synaptic proteome

finding: The lead SNP rs35112771 was associated with the 18q21.33 locus and provided convincing evidence of eQTL colocalisation with SERPINB7 in non-sun-exposed skin tissue. SERPINB7 was implicated in several eczematous conditions and nonsense mutations were known to cause Nagashima-Type Palmoplantar Keratosis, indicating that common mutations influencing SERPINB7 expression could explain the missing heritability in atopic dermatitis.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: The variant rs6567160 also demonstrated positive causal effects and was noted for introducing horizontal pleiotropy, affecting the causal estimates regarding the relationship between physical activity and BMI.
title: Mendelian randomization suggests a bidirectional, causal relationship between physical inactivity and obesity

finding: The variant rs1052025 near NFATC1 was reported as one of the original candidate loci, with a significant p-value of 3.6×10⁻⁴, indicating it also showed evidence for selection though less strong than rs2549794. Its analysis contributed towards the understanding of immune response, particularly in context with the historical effects of the Black Death.
title: Reply to Barton et al: signatures of natural selection during the Black Death
